required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anlotinib Plus Sintilimab as First-line Treatment for Patients With Advanced Colorectal Cancer (APICAL-CR)
clinical_study.official_title: Anlotinib Plus Sintilimab as First-line Treatment for Patients With Advanced Colorectal Cancer (APICAL-CR): a Single Center, Single-arm Phase II Study (APICAL-CR)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination of Anlotinib and Sintilimab in advanced colorectal cancer as first-line treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Anlotinib is a new, orally administered tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets vascular endothelial growth factor receptor (VEGFR), fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR), platelet-derived growth factor receptors (PDGFR), and c-kit. Sintilimab is a fully human IgG4 monoclonal antibody that binds to programmed cell death receptor-1 (PD-1), thereby blocking the interaction of PD-1 with its ligands (PD-L1 and PL-L2) and consequently helping to restore the endogenous antitumour T-cell response. In the present study, we design a single-arm, single center Phase II trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the combination of Anlotinib and Sintilimab in advanced colorectal cancer as first-line treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with reduction in tumor burden of a predefined amount, including complete remission and partial remission
primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria until first documented progress through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of treatment beginning until the date of death from any cause, through study completion, an average of 3 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment beginning until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 weeks
Evaluation of tumor burden based on RECIST criteria through study completion, an average of 6 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Investigation of depth of response during first-line treatment

arm_group.description: the combination of Anlotinib with Sintilimab as first-line treatment

intervention.description: Anlotinib 12mg oral administration daily d1-d14, q3w; Sintilimab 200mg iv drop d1, q3w

facility.name: Department of Medical Oncology, Shanghai Changzheng Hospital
